The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) in New York has appointed Benjamin R. Hunt as its new associate curator of Asian art. He is the eleventh person to be appointed to the position—the term was first shared by Henry Luce in 1963 and has since been elected by a majority vote. Hunt joins the institution from the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where he has served as the chief curator of Asian art since 2006.
